#9159 proves that the Erd≈ës-Kaplansky theorem: the dimension of an infinite dimensional dual space is equal to its cardinality. As a consequence, an infinite dimensional vector space is not isomorphic to its dual.

Because I did it in the generality of division rings, it requires generalizing Subfield (#8941) and computing the cardinality of Subfield.closure in a division ring (#8942), and all three PRs are awaiting review.

About the choice of the approach of #8942, see this topic
Do we expect to want something where the commutativity condition is bundled up as well? I.e., will we need bundled-commutative-subfields of (noncommutative) division rings?
At any rate, I think we should just merge this now. And we can worry about these questions in follow-up PRs

Yeah, I thought about commutative subfields of non-commutative division rings here, which would be obtained by extending the current Subfield with a mul_comm field, and could be named DivisionRing.Subfield.
I think that's a bigger can of worms, since we also want commutative subgroups of groups, subrings of rings, etc
Elsewhere I think we used IsCommutatuve (*) K for that
Yeah, the question will really be whether we need the lattice of bundled-commutative-subfoos
And I'm not sure we'll have a need for that
